intro: Solms-laubachia marinellii, commonly known as the coastal solms-laubachia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in arid and saline environments. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its root system is shallow and highly sensitive to salt, which limits its distribution to specific microhabitats. Due to habitat destruction and climate change, Solms-laubachia marinellii is considered vulnerable and is of interest for conservation efforts.
